data.title: Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle
data.meta_description: The National Museum of Natural History has amazed visitors since 1640.
data.text:
The National Museum of Natural History has amazed visitors since 1640.

The garden presents an amazing variety of plant life, with over 6000 different species. The Grande Galerie de l'Évolution (Gallery of Evolution), which spans 7500 m², illustrates the diversity of the living world with its animal display.

Spotlight on Families:

Parents and children can learn more about the challenges of biodiversity through a range of virtual reality experiments (from age 12 upwards). Don't miss the Galerie de Paléontologie et d'Anatomie comparée (Gallery of Palaeontology and Comparative Anatomy), the Greenhouses and the Zoo with 5.5 ha dedicated to wildlife in the heart of Paris.

Facilities and services

Individual advance tickets at discounted prices (20+ tickets), tickets valid for 2 years. E-tickets available when buying 20–49 tickets.

Guided tours for groups (booking required)

Venue hire: galleries, amphitheatre, auditorium, etc.

Events and activities

Museum cultural events: free events (films, public classes, talks)

Ecology commitment

The Museum gives a voice to its researchers, and conferences and interviews on biodiversity are available online.

Opening and closing times

All year round, daily. Jardin des Plantes (botanical garden): open 7.45am – 8pm daily in summer and 8am – 5.30pm daily in winter.

Greenhouses and Botanic Gallery: open 10am – 5pm from the beginning of October until the end of March and 10am – 6pm from April to October. Closed on Tuesdays.

Gallery of Evolution: open daily 10am – 6pm. Closed on Tuesdays, 1 May, 25 December and 1 January.

Zoo: Open daily 9am – 5pm in winter and 9am – 6pm in summer.

Galleries of Palaeontology and Comparative Anatomy: Open daily 10am Closed on Tuesdays, 1 May, 25 December and 1 January.

Reception

Additional information

On site restaurant :

La Baleine Restaurant in the Botanical Gardens. Open in april 2018.

For more information about accessibility, see the accessible establishments directory on www.accessible.net.
